conclusion: When the silicon photocell is connected to the resistor R, the working point of the circuit is the intersection P of curve a (photocell U-I characteristic) and line b (resistor U-I characteristic).
From the graph this intersection is at current I ≈ 0.20 A and terminal voltage U ≈ 2.5 V.
The open-circuit (no-load) voltage of the photocell, i.e. the intercept of curve a on the U-axis, is about E ≈ 3.6 V.
For a source with emf E, terminal voltage U and current I, the internal resistance r is r = (E – U) / I.
Substituting the values read from the graph, r = (3.6 V – 2.5 V) / 0.20 A, r ≈ 1.1 Ω.
Therefore, the internal resistance of the silicon photocell at this light intensity is about r ≈ 1.1 Ω.
